intro.description: TAK (Team Awareness Kit): A GPS-enabled platform for real-time tracking of friendly forces, sharing observations, and receiving command updates.
intro.title: TAK

phase1.step1_desc_civ: Download the ATAK-CIV app from the Play Store and install it:
phase1.step1_desc_sync: Download the ATAK Data Sync-plugin and install it:
phase1.step2_desc_error: If the application gives an error message, select "Wait".
phase1.step2_desc_permissions: Open the app and grant all requested permissions.
phase1.step2_title: Open the ATAK app and grant permissions

phase2.step1_desc_1: When opening the TAK app for the first time, the TAK Device Setup appears.
phase2.step1_desc_3: The Select Data Package menu will open.
phase2.step1_title: 1. Open the Select Data Package menu
phase2.step2_desc_1: Locate the folder where you downloaded your Client Package file <bold>'Name.zip'</bold>.
phase2.step2_desc_2: Tip: Press <bold>Date</bold> to see the most recently downloaded file, likely your client package.
phase2.step2_title: 2. Find and select the message base zip
phase2.step3_desc_2: You will receive several notifications about the loading of configuration files.
phase2.step3_desc_4: Check the bottom right corner to confirm your server connection is activated (green light).

phase3.step1_desc_1: Press the three lines (hamburger icon) in the top right corner.
phase3.step1_desc_2: Scroll to the bottom of the menu and select <bold>Settings</bold>.
phase3.step2_desc_1: Select <bold>My Team</bold> and choose the color you were instructed to use.
phase3.step2_desc_2: Select <bold>My Role</bold>. Unless otherwise specified by your superiors, all command post users should use the <bold>Team Member</bold> role.
phase3.step2_desc_3: Your role and team are now set.

phase4.step1_desc_1: a. In the main view, open the hamburger menu and find <bold>Plugins</bold>. (You must have the Data Sync plugin installed from Google Play.)
phase4.step1_desc_2: b. The Plugins menu opens. Press on the line for <bold>Data Sync</bold> where it says <bold>"Status: Not loaded."</bold>
phase4.step1_desc_3: c. The app asks if you want to load Data Sync. Press <bold>Load</bold>.
phase4.step1_desc_4: d. The status of Data Sync changes to <bold>Loaded</bold>.
phase4.step1_desc_5: Ready! You can exit the menu.
phase4.step2_desc_1: In the main view, open the hamburger menu and select <bold>Data Sync</bold>.
phase4.step2_desc_2: Opening the Data Sync menu reveals feeds available from the server.
phase4.step2_desc_3: Select the feed(s) you've been instructed to subscribe to (example: <bold>RECON</bold>).
phase4.step2_desc_4: From the popup window, select <bold>Download & Sync</bold>.
phase4.step2_desc_5: Recon Feed is now enabled. You will receive markers on your map from the command post.
phase4.step3_desc_1: Ensure <bold>Auto Download</bold> is on. Return to the main view and open the hamburger menu.
phase4.step3_desc_3: Find the <bold>Auto Download Updates</bold> setting and ensure it is turned on.
phase4.step3_desc_4: This ensures ATAK automatically downloads updates for your subscribed feeds.

phase5.step1_desc_1: To select a map base, open <bold>Maps</bold> from the toolbar (top right corner).
phase5.step1_desc_2: Acknowledge a few notifications by pressing <bold>OK</bold>.
phase5.step1_desc_3: Choose the <bold>Mobile</bold> tab and activate the <bold>02 Google Hybrid</bold> map base.
phase5.step1_desc_4: Exit the menu by pressing the <bold>Back</bold> button a few times.
phase5.step2_desc_1: In ATAK, unit settings are usually preconfigured by your installed Client Package. Check or adjust them as follows:
phase5.step2_desc_2_6: Select <bold>Speed Units</bold> and choose <bold>KM per Hour (kmph)</bold>.
phase5.step2_desc_2_7: Scroll to <bold>UNIT THRESHOLD</bold>, select <bold>Meters to Kilometers</bold>, set to <bold>1000</bold>, and press <bold>OK</bold>.
phase5.step2_desc_3: Units are now set. Exit the menu by pressing the back button several times.
phase5.step3_desc_1: Your callsign is usually set by your installed Client Package. To change it:
phase5.step3_title: 3. Check and change the Callsign if necessary
